sentence: He was followed by Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman of Centre County with 12 votes; GOP strategist and public relations firm CEO Charlie Gerow with seven; Chester County Chamber of Business and Industry CEO Guy Ciarrocchi, with five; former congressman Lou Barletta of Luzerne County, with four; and Dr. Nche Zama, a retired cardiothoracic surgeon from Northampton County, with one vote.
title: Last of GOP regional straw polls hand victories to Bartos, White for U.S. Senate, governor

sentence: "From parroting Donald Trump's lies about the election to embracing his far-right agenda," Pennsylvania Democratic Party spokesman Brendan Welch said in a statement, "Lou Barletta is running a campaign defined by Trumpian litmus tests and dangerous conspiracy theories."
author: Igor Derysh
title: Is Pennsylvania losing it? Hate groups proliferate as state GOP descends into MAGA paranoia

sentence: The four — Lou Barletta, Jake Corman, Bill McSwain and Dave White — issued the joint statement Monday night, eight weeks before the May 17 primary election.
author: Associated Press
title: 4 GOP candidates for Pa. governor set rules to join a debate

sentence: It was a lighthearted reprieve from an hour of consensus, as Lou Barletta, Bill McSwain, Jake Corman and Dave White — those in the field who have registered by name in recent polling — mostly agreed on the need to unleash Pennsylvania’s energy sector, cut the corporate net income tax rate and make the state less of a regulatory maze for businesses.
author: Julian Routh
title: GOP governor candidates take magic wand approach to fix one thing in Pennsylvania

sentence: Former congressman Lou Barletta, state Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman, former U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain and former Delaware County councilman Dave White won’t take part in any debate that is not moderated by a Republican who lives in the state.
title: Editorial: GOP candidates should embrace better debates

sentence: HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Republican Bill McSwain pledges to be a pro-energy governor by “turning on the spigot of natural gas.” Another hopeful, Dave White, says he wants Pennsylvania “to be the energy capital of the world.” A third candidate, Lou Barletta, says having a glut of natural gas in the ground without a pipeline is “like being in college and having a keg of beer without a tap.” In Pennsylvania, the No.

title: 'Whiplash-inducing': Trump is 'still sowing chaos' in Pennsylvania GOP politics

sentence: A WHTM/Emerson College Polling/The Hill Pennsylvania primary survey last week showed former Rep. Lou Barletta (19.8%) with a slight lead over state Sen. Doug Mastriano (19.4%) in the GOP gubernatorial primary race.
author: Charlie McCarthy
title: Trump Blasts Pennsylvania Governor Hopeful McSwain, Withholds Endorsement

sentence: The blow to Mr. McSwain‘s campaign, coupled with the expected decision by state Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman to quit the race, leaves former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta and state Sen. Doug Mastriano as the two most prominent GOP candidates for governor.

title: Trump slams GOP candidate in Pa. governor’s race for not going after 2020 election fraud

sentence: Corman’s withdrawal still would have left eight Republican candidates vying for the party’s nomination, including McSwain, former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, state Sen. Doug Mastriano and former Delaware County Councilman Dave White.

title: Jake Corman is staying in the Republican race for Pennsylvania governor after moving to drop out
